I experience exactly the same problem with JUnit 4.8: Annotating the test=
ing class with @Category(...) has no effect, but annotating its methods wit=
h @Category(...) works.

Since I'm not the only one with this, i assume it =
is a bug.

And I'm wondering where CategoryType.class has gone: It is menti=
oned in JUnit 4.8 Javadoc saying you should extend CategoryType to define a=
 new Category, but this class is not included.

Either the info in the Java=
doc is wrong on this or the class is missing.

Kind regards,
Markus

--- In=
 junit@yahoogroups.com, "gregomena" <gregomena@...> wrote:
>
> I've been te=
sting. And everything is great when the annotation is in methods, but when =
it's in the class, tests are not executed.
>
